items.name: Intelligence Bureau
items.description: India's internal security and counter-intelligence agency under the Ministry of Home Affairs

items.name: Research and Analysis Wing
items.description: Foreign intelligence agency of India for gathering foreign intelligence and countering terrorism.

items.name: Defence Intelligence Agency
items.description: Intelligence agency responsible for providing and coordinating defence and military intelligence to the Indian Armed Forces.

items.name: Central Bureau of Investigation
items.description: Domestic crime investigating agency of India. It operates under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions.

items.name: Directorate of Air Intelligence
items.description: Intelligence arm of the Indian Air Force. It provides timely, accurate, and synchronized intelligence support for tactical, operational needs of the Air force.

items.name: Indian Police Service
items.description: Civil service under the All India Services. It replaced the Imperial Police in 1948.

items.name: Bureau of Police Research and Development
items.description: Set up on 28 August 1970 in furtherance of the objective of the Government of India for the modernization of police forces.

items.name: Wildlife Crime Control Bureau
items.description: Statutory body established by the Government of India under the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change to combat organized wildlife crime.

items.name: National Technical Research Organisation
items.description: Technical intelligence agency under the National Security Advisor in the Prime Minister's Office, India.

items.name: National Crime Records Bureau
items.description: Indian government agency responsible for collecting and analyzing crime data as defined by the Indian Penal Code and Special and Local Laws.

items.name: National Disaster Response Force
items.description: Indian specialized force constituted 'for the purpose of special response to a threatening disaster situation or disaster' under the Disaster Management Act, 2005.

items.name: National Institute of Criminology and Forensic Science
items.description: Trains in cybercrime investigations and researches aspects of criminology and forensics (including cyberforensics)

items.name: Central Forensic Science Laboratory
items.description: A wing of the Ministry of Home Affairs, houses the only DNA repository in South and Southeast Asia.

items.name: Income Tax Department
items.description: India's premier financial agency, responsible for a wide variety of financial and fiscal matters.

items.name: Enforcement Directorate Agency
items.description: Domestic law enforcement agency and economic intelligence agency responsible for enforcing economic laws and fighting economic crime in India.

items.name: Reserve Bank of India
items.description: India's central bank responsible for monetary policy and currency issuance.

items.name: Directorate of Revenue Intelligence
items.description: Intelligence-based organization responsible for the coordination of India's anti-smuggling efforts.

items.name: Securities and Exchange Board of India
items.description: Regulatory body for securities and commodity market in India under the ownership of the Ministry of Finance within the Government of India.

items.name: Goods and Services Tax Council
items.description: Constitutional body responsible for making recommendations on issues related to the implementation of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) in India.

items.name: Indian Council of Medical Research
items.description: Coordinates and promotes biomedical research in India.

items.name: National Health Mission
items.description: Implements healthcare programs at the state level.

items.name: National AIDS Control Organization
items.description: Works to prevent and control HIV/AIDS in India.

items.name: University Grants Commission
items.description: Regulates and funds higher education institutions.

items.name: Indian Space Research Organisation
items.description: Operates as the primary research and development arm of the Department of Space, which is directly overseen by the Prime Minister of India.

items.name: Council of Scientific and Industrial Research
items.description: Promotes scientific research and development.
